(Same as WGS 385W 5)
ITAL 360W-1  Machiavelli and His Gendered World
Dr. Gary Waters TT 10:00-11:15AM
Content:  The Florentine writer Niccol√≤ Machiavelli is most often remembered for his contribution to early political theory with his infamous work the Prince, but he also presents a remarkable opportunity to examine Renaissance conceptions of masculinity, femininity, gender relations, and the introduction of sexual violence into the political sphere. This course will examine Machiavelli's self-presentation and performativity in his various writings as well as how he viewed the division of the sexes and their characteristics in their varying social roles.
course_description: General introduction to some of the major issues and trends of this cultural era as well as the contributions and principal works of the writers involved in the development and crisis of Renaissance culture in Italy.
